alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 7:41PM EST until January 12 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Louisburg affecting Franklin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Tar River at Louisburg. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Bankfull in the vicinity of Main Street. Minor flooding begins in River Bend Park 0.1 miles upstream of Main Street. At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Banks overflow at Main Street. River Bend Park is flooded and storm drains are inundated along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Thursday the stage was 21.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Thursday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested around 21.3 feet and is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 7.2 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tar River Louisbur 20.0 21.1 Thu 7 pm EST 14.5 12.1 10.5 8.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 745 AM EST.
